title: Alfa Romeo - Wikipedia
snippet: Through the 1920s, Alfa Romeo produced several successful road and race cars, and was well represented in prominent European motorsport events, notably winning the inaugural AIACR World Manufacturers' Championship at the 1925 Grand Prix season. Nevertheless, the company soon faced financial troubles, leading to Romeo's contentious departure in 1928 and Italian government ownership in 1933.

title: Who owns Alfa Romeo? | Alfa Romeo History | Genesis Alfa Romeo
snippet: When Cavalier Ugo Stella purchased the shares of an italian automotive plant in Milan, the company’s legacy of sport-oriented vehicles began. The name Alfa is actually an acronym for, “Anonima Lombarda Fabbrica Automobili” – A.L.F.A.

title: History of Alfa Romeo - Wikipedia
snippet: In 1933 ownership of Alfa Romeo passed, through IRI, to the Italian state because of the heavy debt the company had incurred with banks since the previous decade.

title: Who Owns Alfa Romeo? | Alfa Romeo of Plano
snippet: From 2007 on, Alfa Romeo was owned by Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA). However, on January 16, 2021, FCA merged its operations with the French PSA Group, Peugeot S.A., to form Stellantis, now recognized as the fourth largest automaker globally.

title: Who Owns Alfa Romeo | Alfa Romeo FIAT of Santa Monica
snippet: While Alfa Romeo is a long-respected ... “Who owns Alfa Romeo now?” Fiat-Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) purchased the automaker in 2007 and then later merged with the PSA group to form Stellantis....
